q: What is the main strategy for climbing BR ranked?
a: The main strategy involves perfect landing choices (mid-tier loot zones like Mars Electric or Mill), efficient looting (prioritize AR + armor in first 60 seconds), smart rotation timing (move at 60% zone closure), and endgame positioning (secure center circle with high ground).
source: Perfect Your Landing Strategy & Zone Rotation Mastery sections

q: What's the best sensitivity for ranked mode?
a: Sensitivity depends on your device. Medium phones (400 DPI) should use General: 85, Red Dot: 75, Scope 2x: 70. Adjust based on playstyle - rushers add +10, snipers reduce scope sensitivity by -10.

q: When should I rotate to the next zone?
a: Start moving when the zone is at 60% closure, not when fully closed. This gives time to choose optimal paths avoiding open areas, secure vehicles if needed, pre-position in strong compounds, and avoid getting sandwiched between zone and enemies.

q: What are the key combat fundamentals?
a: Pre-aim corners when entering buildings, use headglitch spots on high ground, strafe while shooting (A-D-A-D pattern), don't peek same angle twice, and practice one-tap headshots as they can cut time-to-kill in half.
source: Combat Fundamentals That Win Fights section

q: How many gloo walls should I carry for endgame?
a: Keep 4-6 gloo walls for final zone. They're more valuable than ammunition in final circles. Always carry minimum 2 gloo walls as baseline throughout the match.

q: Should I hot drop in ranked?
a: Hot drops like Clock Tower and Peak give early kills and quick points but are extremely high-risk. For consistent ranked climbing, consider mid-tier loot zones like Mars Electric, Rim Nam Village, or Mill where you can gear up safely while securing 2-3 early-game kills.
